lines.text: You two are not married. The ceremony Woo Ching read for you was the burial ceremony.
That's Chinese burial service, that's why you are wearing white clothes.
You are aware that you face a possible sentence of death, not to mention a total imprisonment of...
I'm going to the beach and get a canoe.

[opening up Ginger's coat and seeing her shapely figure and scanty costume]
Hey, that's nice candy!
Don't let him bother you, baby. He just wishes he met you first.

[ogling her]
You're so right! I could go for her on a rainy afternoon.

[to Davey]
It couldn't rain hard enough for me to go for him!
Nice place you got here, Madame!

[referring to the three prostitutes in her stable]
You do not like my darling nieces, monsieur?

[ogling her]
I stopped picking green apples when I left the farm. Ripe fruit is sweeter.
Just like that Shakespeare said - there's nothing like a quivering arrow from Cupid's bow!

[to Ginger Martin]
All we need is a preacher and a motel.
